website_summaries.verdict: Company works directly with farmers for quality end product. Gluten-free, organic and made in the USA and Canada.
pros: Could be used as a substitute for eggs
Good for those keeping a vegan diet
Help to keep your system regular and may increase your daily water consumption
Blend well with most foods and drinks
cons: Need a grinder to grind into powder for use in most recipes, and foods
May need a sieve to remove small rocks, grit, and black stones

customer_reviews.title: This is helping...
customer_reviews.text: This is helping me kill two birds with one stone. I am able to get in 4 tbsp of this a day and I find that I am drinking more water to help. I actually let my seeds sit for about an hour in my water, which is either lukewarm or hot, and I add raw honey. The seeds produce a white foam that I drain off with my water to drink. I also sometimes drink the seeds in my water. It doesn't have a taste and works better if you drink before a meal because it helps wit h digestion. I will definitely be reordering this to have on hand.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia B.

customer_reviews.title: Been using Bob's Red Mill flax seeds for many years. Always great.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using Bob's Red Mill flax seeds (both brown and golden) for many years and have never been disappointed. Fresh, usually well packaged (only happened once a batch were two of the bags were not sealed in a corner), no foreign particles. I grind them with a spice and nut grinder
customer_reviews.author: RM

customer_reviews.title: Better taste, lower omega 3
customer_reviews.text: Tastes better than the brown variety. Supposedly the brown (Canadian) flax seed has a higher omega 3 fatty acid content (only a couple of percentage points according to a study that's easy to find). The golden flax seed seems to have a softer husk than the brown, if the sound they make when being ground up in a coffee grinder is any indication. I'd give the brown ones four stars as well, but for the higher omega 3 levels. A five star rating would be flax seed that had better taste overall, but that's not the reason you eat the stuff in the first place.
customer_reviews.author: PDC

customer_reviews.title: Extremely helpful in raising my good cholesterol levels
customer_reviews.text: I've had lower than recommended levels of the good cholesterol type until I started adding a few tablespoons of ground flax seed to my smoothies and other meals everyday. Its been slow, but my good cholesterol levels have been consistently climbing and are now comfortably above the recommended minimum levels. There's nothing else in my diet that would have helped with this. Considering I hate fish, this has been really helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Michal T.

customer_reviews.title: Short changed one 24 oz bag
customer_reviews.text: Ordered 3 years ago and finally opened this last box after consuming the same bob mills flax boxes ordered previously. This box was oviously taped back up after removing one 24 oz bag so I only got 3 bags instead of 4 as stated on original order and listed on the box. Extra space packed with inflate bags so without opening, can't tell a bag is missing. I will from now on open the box when received instead of just storing in the pantry. Warning to all...too late to complain now
customer_reviews.author: kennyr

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful stuff
customer_reviews.text: Great source of vegetable based omega-3 fats (most health articles insist that animal-based omega-3's are superior); good source of fiber and magnesium also. Promotes regularity and is a great addition to many dishes: salads, yogurt and even raw (I always add organic Ceylon Cinnamon and often fruit like dried cherries). I prefer the Golden to Brown and Organic ALWAYS, but that's just a personal opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Leader of the free world

customer_reviews.title: Flaxseed with omega-3s
customer_reviews.text: I like to make smoothies with flaxseed. I bought the Organic golden flaxseed but I prefer plain flaxseed without omega-3. This is a good product if your looking for flaxseed with omega- 3.
customer_reviews.author: Eliza

customer_reviews.title: Great Ground Up for Muscle and Joint Pain
customer_reviews.text: Grind this up finely so it does not pass through your system, as advised by my physician. It has helped me with joint pain.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Great company, great product and highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Great company and would recommend all their products. I also purchase from Whole Foods their millet, amaranth and buckwheat. I do not buy products in bulk anymore because concerned about cross contamination with gluten, even though I do not know if I have a gluten issue, I stay away, regardless. Their products are all tested for gluten, as well. I also enjoy reading all the information on the packages, as it is very educational and give recipes, too
customer_reviews.author: Torah Observant Jewess

customer_reviews.title: Pay attention to the fact these are seeds not flax meal
customer_reviews.text: Read very carefully when ordering this because I thought it was flax meal. I searched flax meal and didn’t pay close attention. They are flax seeds. I don’t have a grinder and I couldn’t return this without it not being worth it
customer_reviews.author: Becca M

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be excellent product at good price.
customer_reviews.text: I have no idea of nutritional differences between different colors of flaxseeds - will check for next time, but meanwhile, these were good price, grind up easily in our little coffee grinder for fresh flax seed powder. They seeds are uniformly colored and shiny -- nothing looks too old, no sign of mold or discoloration. Have to check about keeping the unused bags in the freezer, or still in just the refridgerator. Winds up being a lot of flaxseed if you're grinding for powder, but also economical to buy that way.
customer_reviews.author: sara15

customer_reviews.title: Milder than brown seeds, but don't let them just sail right on through you!
customer_reviews.text: These golden seeds are so much milder tasting than the brown, you can use them in a lot more things and not even taste them. Of course they are wonderfully good for you! BUT they must be ground up first. Whole seeds will journey right through you without doing any good. That would be even worse for anyone with diverticulosis where seeds get stuck in, well, intestional pockets. I grind mine fresh in a small blender every morning.Add them to all your baking, especially home made breads and muffins. Great source of fiber of course, and we alll know how necessary that is. Keep them in the freezer for maximum freshness.
customer_reviews.author: CarolynnTop Contributor: Baking

customer_reviews.title: Fresh & Pretty
customer_reviews.text: I thought that I had bought the Flaxseed Meal but when it arrived I saw that I had pulled another of my brain dead tricks and got the wrong stuff. No problem though. The food processor will have them turned into meal in a hot minute. 15 minutes later we still have seed. The Kitchen Aid grain mill says not to grind anything too oily, so that left the trusty old coffee grinder. I had beautiful flaxmeal in a matter of seconds! It actually looks like a finer grind than the packaged meal, so I am a happy camper!
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne

customer_reviews.title: They are so good and the they are good for you
customer_reviews.text: I use them to make flax seed crackers, I soak them and then add nuts, dry pineapple, raisins dates, and dry cranberries. Then I flatten them out on baking sheet, sprinkle them with sea salt and put them in a 200 degree oven for 8 hours. They are so good and the they are good for you, better than anything you could buy. I call it my tree bark , that is what it looks like
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Edmondson

customer_reviews.title: Very good flax seed
customer_reviews.text: Very good flax seed. Grinds well. Has a very nice nutty smell. I give this to my dog for her arthritis pain-she hasn’t needed any more cortisone shots since I put her on this daily and she no longer limps.
customer_reviews.author: Viola Forame

customer_reviews.title: but NOT ORGANIC like my last order of four packaged
customer_reviews.text: Misadvertised !!! Says ORGANIC BUT ITS NOT !!Shows box of (4) in a Bobs red mill box. Not So. Its in simple cardboard box. IS THIS THE REAL STUFF ?? Dont know ! The single packages say Bobs, but NOT ORGANIC like my last order of four packaged. IS IT REAL OR A KNOCKOFF? Dont know !!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Val Marcinczyk

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Wholesome Product
customer_reviews.text: High quality flax seeds, that come in a resealable bag, and stays fresh for months. I grind the seeds into a meal using a coffee bean grinder, and then mix it into lots of different foods (e.g. yogurt, oatmeal, salads, muffins). This is an excellent nutritional food that I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: ANF

customer_reviews.title: I can buy a quantity much larger here than at supermarket.
customer_reviews.text: I use flaxseed to improve my digestion while getting a shot of omega 3 for my health. I appreciate getting large bags instead of the tiny bags offered in the supermarket.
customer_reviews.author: Russell E. Dexter

customer_reviews.title: Always Fresh
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I prefer Bob's Red Mill Golden Flaxseeds over the brown flax seeds. We purchased a small, electric coffee mill to grind our flaxseeds before adding it to our morning oatmeal and we enjoy their mild nutty flavor. We like this product so much, that we are signed up to receive regular shipments by the the case. I store the extra bags in the freezer and the seeds I'm presently using, I store in a jar in my cupboard. We go through it fast enough that the milled golden flax are always delightfully fresh.
customer_reviews.author: SMC

customer_reviews.title: Fresh Tasting!!!
customer_reviews.text: It is hard to find flaxseed that is not rancid. This brand has the freshest tasting flaxseed that I have found!
customer_reviews.author: Charles Norman

customer_reviews.title: Top quality flaxseed!
customer_reviews.text: These are a good deal for golden flax seeds. They taste good and fresh. They can be used for many things and are a healthy addition to any diet. I love to make flax crackers with them. This is another excellent product from Bob's Red Mill.
customer_reviews.author: Serena Reed

customer_reviews.title: Eat these every day
customer_reviews.text: Excellent value for this product. I grind flax seed with chia and toasted sesame seeds and put them on my cereal everyday. These are clean, fresh and arrived on time. Excellent source of omega-3 and lignans. And, they are organic ;-)
customer_reviews.author: moonshine

customer_reviews.title: I keep buying these again and again
customer_reviews.text: because they are relatively inexpensive and good for you. I keep the seeds in the freezer and grind about 6-8 oz at a time to use for a week in practically everything I bake or blend.
customer_reviews.author: Alla

customer_reviews.title: Flaxseed is great! One of the foods I make sure to ...
customer_reviews.text: Flaxseed is great! One of the foods I make sure to consume daily. I think these flaxseeds are great quality, but they are a bit on the expensive side, where you can buy other brands much cheaper elsewhere, especially if they are not organic. Big Lots is one place I usually buy mine.
customer_reviews.author: stevo629

customer_reviews.title: Mixes well and tastes wonderful.
customer_reviews.text: I use this daily in my smoothies for the freshest flax. Mixes well and tastes wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: Patscats

customer_reviews.title: They're Good Seeds.
customer_reviews.text: These Flaxseeds are of good quality, I eat them daily. Bought the whole seed, rather than the ground seed, because of the better nutritional value of grinding your own. Will buy again. I read that whole seeds can pass undigested, and that ground seeds can loose their nutritional value over time. So we grind a week's worth at a time. Best used in oatmeal as the flavors blend well. Or in a cold cereal, or added to a cup of coffee for a twist. Seem to blend better in hot foods.
customer_reviews.author: RightReviewNow

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Golden flaxseed looks great, very clean. Grind some everyday and put on cereal or oatmeal.
customer_reviews.author: charles m

customer_reviews.title: It is the best.
customer_reviews.text: Grinds into meal very easily. By this one. It is the best.
customer_reviews.author: earthmama

customer_reviews.title: My Choice
customer_reviews.text: I use these almost daily in various baking and cooking. I've used the brown seeds as wall as the golden and there doesn't seem to be any difference which I use. Both are fine, and except for color. So take your choice - but get it from Bob's Red Mill if you want the best, cleanest and freshest!
customer_reviews.author: HazelnutTop Contributor: Baking

customer_reviews.title: Quality for price
customer_reviews.text: These are really good Golden Flaxseeds. Price was very good and they were packaged really well. What I expect from Bob's Red Mill products. Thanks Bob Red Mill!
customer_reviews.author: Ter

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my homemade granola! This is so healthy for my digestion and it is working just fine!
customer_reviews.author: farah sumcad

customer_reviews.title: Good to know we're getting good nutrition
customer_reviews.text: We put them in smoothies. Good to know we're getting good nutrition.
customer_reviews.author: June Tanis

customer_reviews.title: great product indeed
customer_reviews.text: This is great product and I have been purchasing it for years and happy with it. good quality
customer_reviews.author: emilylund

customer_reviews.title: It’s seeds not ground
customer_reviews.text: Good stuff, I sometimes eat it right out of the package. Try it on pies and cakes. Delicious!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Trump

customer_reviews.title: The best ever, the golden
customer_reviews.text: The best ever, the golden, whole flax seeds are the most nutritious of all. You have to grind them though before ingesting so that your body can benefit from it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful deal
customer_reviews.text: These are the "golden" ones and will not look nasty when used raw in salads, etc. They grind easily into a flour for baking and yet have wonderful crunch when whole. This is by far the most economical way to buy this item if you use a lot. Have never had a problem with rancidity, but if you keep them more than a two or three weeks it's wise to refrigerate.
customer_reviews.author: wjb

customer_reviews.title: perfect. can grind small amounts at a time for ...
customer_reviews.text: perfect. can grind small amounts at a time for freshness, use it every day! came as described. hard to find in stores. mostly carry the darker variety. golden flax makes a delicious powdered product.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn Bakst

customer_reviews.title: It was well packaged. right now I only use ...
customer_reviews.text: It was well packaged. right now I only use it in my oatmeal I do plan to use it on other foods as well. Because it's in a seed form and not ground I use a coffee grinder to grind it up. I grind up about two weeks supply and refrigerate to maintain the freshness.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon Nadeau

customer_reviews.title: Don't think you can do much better
customer_reviews.text: Another excellent Bob's Red Mill product at a great price. Grind and use on cereal, in pancakes, waffles, oatmeal, etc. Have shipped every 6 months at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I’m never disappointed with Bob’s products, and this is no exception! It’s also a really good price.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany Reeves

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Ordered by mistake - thought it was already ground, but putting it in a grinder has "done the trick."
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This flax is the best. I've used them all and this is hands ...
customer_reviews.text: This flax is the best. I've used them all and this is hands down the best. I love the stuff and put it on everything from cereal to salads. I will continue to purchase this product. Great packaging, delivered when they told me they would.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick van meter

customer_reviews.title: Clean, nutty flavor
customer_reviews.text: This has a clean, nutty flavor and is very easy to grind in my mortar and pestle. Expiration date for my shipment is 2 years from now, so it's nice and fresh. I'm very happy. Only possible improvement would be a resealable bag. (Hint, hint, Bob's Red Mill.)
customer_reviews.author: AngieD

customer_reviews.title: inexpensive and long life when whole. I grind a ...
customer_reviews.text: inexpensive and long life when whole. I grind a little each time I need it and it is always fresh.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph T. Olesik

customer_reviews.title: Same quality as found in Health Food Store
customer_reviews.text: This is the exact same product that is found in health food stores but is much cheaper. I buy the 4 pack box and it last me a few months. I mix the flax with chia seeds and psyllium husks to get my daily fiber and Omega-3. Great product and I would recommend it to anyone looking to save a few dollars without sacrificing quality.
customer_reviews.author: K. Moseley

customer_reviews.title: Bob's Red Mill
customer_reviews.text: We use many Bob's Red Mill products like coconut flour, almond flour, rice flour and we love them all! They're reasonably priced and always fresh. Added bonus: we've never had an issue of any sort with Bob's (odd flavor, broken packaging as we've experienced with other brands). Rather than trying to venture out to other brands we will stay loyal to Bob's Red Mill.
customer_reviews.author: AlonzosMom

customer_reviews.title: Like it
customer_reviews.text: I can't find this in any of our local grocery and health food stores, so I have to buy it on-line. You can buy it from the Bob's Red Mill website, but you have to buy four bags. I don't like paying $4.99 for shipping, but no other option for me.
customer_reviews.author: PS

customer_reviews.title: The package contains a lot of dirt, pebbles, ...
customer_reviews.text: The package contains a lot of dirt, pebbles, little pieces of something, etc. - things that should not belong in any food, particularly organic.
customer_reviews.author: AJS

customer_reviews.title: Healthy does have to be expensive!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought item for a friend who has a health food consulting business to like that the pack of 4 was so affordable.
customer_reviews.author: Sophia

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Put this in your daily smoothies and your hair will stop falling out. Seriously!
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: A great product, from a trusted company, at a highly competitive price.
customer_reviews.author: RON

customer_reviews.title: ORGANIC GOLDEN FLAXSEED (not the flaxmeal)
customer_reviews.text: Great price and I am very happy with this purchase. It is very difficult to find Organic Golden Flaxseed in the stores so was pleased to find it here and it arrived in a timely manner. Will order this same product again later when we get low.
customer_reviews.author: Vera P.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: From past experience . . . never been disappointed. Virgil
customer_reviews.author: Virgil Kemp

customer_reviews.title: very happy with
customer_reviews.text: I purchase this product over and over again. very happy with it
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Great Seeds From A Great Company
customer_reviews.text: This provides lots of flaxseed and at a good price. Bob's commitment to quality has me purchasing several of their seeds and oats. You cannot go wrong with Bob's Red Mill products!
customer_reviews.author: Cam M

customer_reviews.title: RANCID!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these whole seeds plus a grinder because I had a rancid problem with the Bob's Red Mill ground organic golden flaxseeds. This product was rancid also. Packaging date was 10/26/15, Best buy date was 10/26/2017. The seeds had small black rocks mixed with them. I have always had good luck with Bob's Red Mill products, but it seems like their standards and quality have gone down hill. I'm over you Bob!
customer_reviews.author: lambfam

customer_reviews.title: Seem like good quality and clean seeds.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice seeds, great color, and high quality. I don't see any yucky seeds yet, but I am only on my first bag. I like these light colored seeds better than the dark seeds.
customer_reviews.author: Illinois Mama

customer_reviews.title: Love this product!
customer_reviews.text: We add this to our smoothie every morning! So good for you.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I totally eat healthy and have been using this product ...
customer_reviews.text: I totally eat healthy and have been using this product for 9 years. Hope you do not increase this product because of high rating????
customer_reviews.author: Bluedog

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: This product was excellent. Now, I do have to say that I have never had Flaxseed before this so I've not tasted another brand with which to compare. But this product (hulled flaxseed) was fresh and cooked up nicely as a hot, tasty cereal.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Egbg

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: Will always buy their flaxseeds. Great quality for the price.
customer_reviews.author: wm

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product. I grind these in a coffee/spice grinder ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. I grind these in a coffee/spice grinder and add to cereal & oatmeal for breakfast. Just remember to store properly because unless you have a large family this will last you a long time. I keep unopened packages in the freezer and opened ones in the refrigerator. So far this seems to work really well.
customer_reviews.author: Hokie Guy

customer_reviews.title: fresh and nice flavor
customer_reviews.text: I like the golden flax seed better than brown . it has a good flavor and is easy to grind. You can always count on Bob's Red Mill for quality products.
customer_reviews.author: stacey waltz

customer_reviews.title: good seeds but gravel bits
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't thrilled because I had to pick out tiny bits of gravel. The flax seeds themselves were fine, top quality. If it weren't for the gravel bits (that get through the sieve w/the seeds, I guess?), this would get 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Pj Dupuis

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Use this to make hot packs with. Does the job.
customer_reviews.author: sarah

customer_reviews.title: Great product - Reasonably priced
customer_reviews.text: It's everything it's cracked up to be. A great value. Quick delivery, and reasonably priced. I highly recommend it. I use the finest setting on my 'coffee' grinder, and it is finer than you can find already ground. Only 'fault' I can see is that it is very difficult to completely clean out of my bowl/glass, etc. Sticks to the sides of dish. Otherwise a terrific product.
customer_reviews.author: SASSYGRANNY2.9

customer_reviews.title: Yum!
customer_reviews.text: Use the Westmark 63542260 Spice Mill with Ceramic Grinding Mechanism and you will have yummy fresh ground flax seeds! Here's to your health!
customer_reviews.author: VirginiaC

customer_reviews.title: Breakfast of champions!!
customer_reviews.text: Best value for money flaxseed on the market, and we know and trust Bob's brand. I make up my own breakfast cereal and this one of the many ingredients that go into it.
customer_reviews.author: TS971

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you have something like a coffee grinder to grind these with so you ...
customer_reviews.text: Make sure you have something like a coffee grinder to grind these with so you can get the full nutrition.
customer_reviews.author: Juniper

customer_reviews.title: Golden flaxseeds
customer_reviews.text: I use 2 tbsp off ground flaxseed (I use my blender to grind these seeds to a fine powder-then I add them to my smoothie mix daily
customer_reviews.author: Joan Spaunhorst

customer_reviews.title: A must have for healthy life
customer_reviews.text: It's also a routine baking ingredient. I put it into my bread along with sunflower seeds and organic wheat flour. I also put it into my smoothie, stir fry dishes....anything you can think of! Good price and really, it's a must have for a healthy diet!
customer_reviews.author: M. C

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I am using almost every day am enjoying the food that I put it with.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great source for omega3's!
customer_reviews.text: It's best to buy flaxseeds as opposed to flaxseed oil or meal because you get more omega3. Since you are grinding the seeds yourself, the released omega 3 oils are at their freshest. I recommend storing these flaxseeds in the freezer. You can keep them there after you open them as well. I grind 2 tablespoons in a coffee grinder and then add it to yogurt or a protein shake. Good stuff!
customer_reviews.author: Trusted Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product
customer_reviews.text: Have been using flax seeds daily for 10 years and was disappointed when my former brand became unavailable. These seeds are actually better tasting and there were no pebbles in the seed. Will order more when needed
customer_reviews.author: Crash

customer_reviews.title: good price
customer_reviews.text: I love the price, the flavor, but I like the dark better.
customer_reviews.author: L.J.T.

customer_reviews.title: Bob's Red Mill Organic Golden Flaxseed
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd order i have placed for Bob's Red Mill Organic Flaxseed. It is a good quality whole flaxseed. We grind it a little at a time and sprinkle it on cereal and in yogurt. It keeps a long time in the freezer. I have been using this flaxseed for about a year now ,eating a tablespoon about every day and have noticed that my skin is softer , plus it keeps me regular, if ya know what i mean !!! Flaxseed is also a good way to get in some of the Omega 3's, that the body needs.
customer_reviews.author: Roxy

customer_reviews.title: Pleased
customer_reviews.text: Good quality for the money. I do a lot of comparison shopping for quality and economy.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: Great to put on almost anything!
customer_reviews.text: This is by far my favorite way to get omega 3 in my diet. I put it in yogurt, waffles, pasta sauce, salsa, and ice cream. It doesn't change the flavor at all.
customer_reviews.author: J-Bird

customer_reviews.title: Its healthy
customer_reviews.text: Well I thought this was Ground up...Its seeds...perhaps my mistake.
customer_reviews.author: Sea Otter Cindy

customer_reviews.title: A great buy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this item many times and love it. I like to grind the flaxseeds myself because they are fresher this way. Great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Judy from Tx

customer_reviews.title: So good for you!!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this flaxseed after reading how good ground flaxseed was for you. I ordered a grinder, both were reasonably priced, and the grinding was so easily accomplished. I have been using flaxseed daily since that time, and the claims made on the Internet have proven to be true. The product arrived on time and in great shape--I have purchased from this vendor several times, and have not been disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: C. E. Montz

customer_reviews.title: Great product at a great price!
customer_reviews.text: Great product at a great price! Stores in my area have the same product marked up as much as 30%.
customer_reviews.author: Jason H Eggers

customer_reviews.title: Add a serving daily in protein drink.
customer_reviews.text: Product is fresh and packaged securely in their own carton. Grind a small portion and store in refrigerator for a few day's need.
customer_reviews.author: L. S.

customer_reviews.title: Healthy Goodness
customer_reviews.text: I've recently started drinking green smoothies to get healthier and had read that flax seeds have terrific health benefits such as lowering your blood pressure and cholesterol. I add a tablespoon of chia seed and flax seed to my smoothies every day and since drinking my fruits and vegetables I feel better, lost some weight and have stopped having heart flutters. I'm now looking forward to having my next blood work done to see how well it has helped. Highly recommend to anyone wanting to get healthy an all natural way!
customer_reviews.author: R. Colley

customer_reviews.title: Great for granola!
customer_reviews.text: I keep this on-hand for my making homemade granola. This is a very good value for large quantity of golden flaxseeds.
customer_reviews.author: D. M. Rabinowitch

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful flaxseeds
customer_reviews.text: I have almost gone through the entire 4 pack in my cooking. On items that require finer mill I just put into my Kitchenaid blender and it comes out perfect!
customer_reviews.author: bookworm9

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a way to take in omega 3 nutrient. The pack of 4 has lasted me almost a year. You have to grind up the seeds and freeze the rest. No complaints; very reasonable pricing.
customer_reviews.author: Beanstock13

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I use these in smoothies and normal cooking. No complaints they are great
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great product, great price. I make my own flackers with these at a substantial savings.
customer_reviews.author: Anders

customer_reviews.title: Great seeds
customer_reviews.text: I have already used the first bag of seeds and like the flavor . They ground up very well with my new grinder .

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality & Price

customer_reviews.title: Fiber packed and nutrient rich
customer_reviews.text: Flaxseed is a great way to get fiber in your diet and this brand delivers. It has a mild taste (I put 3 tablespoons in my morning smoothie) and gives you 36% of your daily fiber required intake. Flaxseed also contain Omega 3 so you also place a powerhouse of nutrients in your diet with this little seed. An excellent source of protein, fiber, and minerals such as magnesium and copper- how can you go wrong?
customer_reviews.author: D. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: IT'S THE BEST BRAND I KNOW OF, I'M GOOD TO GO.

customer_reviews.title: grind and enjoy!
customer_reviews.text: I use a coffe grinder to grind ait fine and use it on almost everything.Thickins up sauces and is very healthy.After my health food store finds it dificult to keep in stock,I decided to order online for the first time.Came as promises,at a price competitive with my store.Would order again.

product_meta.title: Bob's Red Mill Organic Raw Whole Golden Flaxseeds, 24-ounce
product_meta.description: Size:24 OunceBob's Red Mill Organic Brown Flaxseeds offer a wonderful nutritional boost to almost any recipe. One serving contains 1800mg omega-3 fatty acids, 4g of fiber, 3g of protein, and lignans for a heart-healthy nutritional combination. Mild in flavor, Organic Brown Flaxseeds can be inconspicuously added to almost any recipe - smoothies, shakes, breads, cookies, pancakes, waffles, and more. Sprinkle on eggs, oatmeal or salad greens, or toss with grains and veggies in a pilaf -the possibilities are truly endless. Like all of our gluten free-labeled products, this product is processed in a dedicated gluten free facility and R5-ELISA tested to confirm its gluten free status. Certified Organic by QAI.
feature_bullets: USDA Certified Organic; Gluten Free; Vegan; Vegetarian; Paleo Friendly; Kosher Pareve
Manufactured in a dedicated gluten free facility; R5-ELISA tested gluten free
1800mg Omega-3 fatty acids; Good source of fiber; Contains lignans
Great for sprouting, grinding, or eating whole
